snippet: Senator John D. Rockefeller, a Democrat from West Virginia, said he was concerned that personal information about people could be collected and sold to their potential detriment.
abstract: Senator John D Rockefeller IV, responding to growing force of the multibillion-dollar data brokerage industry, opens extensive investigation of nine leading information brokers; says he is concerned that personal information about people can be collected and sold to their potential detriment.
lead_paragraph: Senator John D. Rockefeller, a Democrat from West Virginia, said he was concerned that personal information about people could be collected and sold to their potential detriment.

headline.seo: Senator Opens Investigation of Data Brokers
headline.main: Senator Opens Investigation of Data Brokers
headline.print_headline: Citing Deep Data Collections, Senator Opens Inquiry of Information Brokers
